channel.title: BBC News

item.title: Woman dies three weeks after car crash
item.description: Hanna Tanasova was taken to hospital after the crash in Lisnaskea but died from her injuries last week.

item.title: Police officer appears in court accused of stealing ammunition
item.description: The officer is charged in connection with the alleged theft of thousands of bullets from a police training facility.

item.title: Assault victim may require reconstructive surgery
item.description: A 46-year-old man sustains serious facial injuries after he was kicked while on the ground.

item.title: Rows over flags, football and censoring Christmas cards - inside the first executive
item.description: Files released by the Public Record Office of Northern Ireland show arguments within the first power-sharing executive.

item.title: 'Such an honour': Stormont guard and Olympian among NI honours recipients
item.description: More than 50 people from Northern Ireland have been recognised in the New Year Honours List.

item.title: Underfunding, overspending and trying to keep the lights on - a year in health
item.description: Will the NI Executive execute plans to avoid the usual health pay crisis next year?

item.title: 'Drugs found' after vehicle crashes into field following PSNI pursuit
item.description: A man in his 40s was arrested after a vehicle crashed into a field near Templepatrick on Monday night.

item.title: Visually impaired gamers urge industry to improve accessibility
item.description: A group made up of blind and partially sighted people say more needs to be done to make them feel included in gaming.

item.title: Mum's warning about hot ashes after oil tank fire
item.description: The fire broke out at a house after hot ashes were put in a bin next to an oil tank.

item.title: Quartet of World Cup berths up for grabs in 2026
item.description: Three words will dominate the talk around international football across the island of Ireland in 2026 - the World Cup.

item.title: 'Superiority' concerns over Royal Yacht Britannia visit to Ireland
item.description: A possible three-day trip to Ireland by the then Prince of Wales, now King Charles III, was cancelled over security concerns.

item.title: Police not seeking suspects after body found in attempted murder case
item.description: A man whose body was found County Down on Saturday has been named as 54 year old Jonathan Baker.

item.title: AI, Kneecap and lampposts: The political A to Z of Northern Ireland in 2025
item.description: BBC NI political correspondent Gareth Gordon looks at the political year that was in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Man charged after woman injured in knife attack
item.description: The man is due to appear before Londonderry Magistrate's Court on Monday.

item.title: School pupils meet-ups 'a lifeline' for retirement housing residents
item.description: A scheme that started four years ago brings primary school pupils together with elderly residents living nearby.

item.title: Assaults on police 'utterly unacceptable', says justice minister
item.description: 14 officers were assaulted on Friday 26 and Saturday 27 December across Northern Ireland.

item.title: Two churches damaged during burglaries over Christmas period
item.description: Damage was caused to both churches with a number of items stolen, including electronic speakers and a wall clock.

item.title: Smyth kicks career-long field goal in Saints win
item.description: Charlie Smyth sets a new personal record with a 57-yard field goal as the New Orleans Saints defeat the Tennessee Titans 34-26.

item.title: Artist Oliver Jeffers 'loves being home' as he returns with new exhibition
item.description: The collection of works called "Disasters and Interventions" is being exhibited at the Naughton Gallery at Queen's University.

item.title: The women keeping history and tradition alive
item.description: A new project aims to shine a light on women working in heritage across Northern Ireland.

item.title: UK government officials said IRA man organised £26.5m bank raid
item.description: Some £26.5m was stolen from the Northern Bank in a crime that threatened to destabilise the peace process.

item.title: 'My dog's death was caused by fireworks' - call for change to regulations
item.description: The Department of Justice (DoJ) is responsible for the control of fireworks in Northern Ireland.

item.title: 'It's important that our kids enjoy coming here' - award for special school
item.description: The east Belfast school has more than 100 pupils aged from three to 19 with a range of needs and disabilities.

item.title: 'Light box helps ease my winter depression'
item.description: Cherry Cantrell has been using a light box to help reduce the symptoms of Seasonal Affective Disorder.

item.title: Meet the working dogs that don't stop for Christmas
item.description: For some of Northern Ireland's dogs with jobs, a busy Christmas lies ahead.

item.title: Sign language interpreters say job can be 'emotional whiplash'
item.description: A new MA Interpreting course at Queen's University is preparing students for the increasing demand for interpreters.

item.title: What do you do if you don't celebrate Christmas?
item.description: A Muslim, a Hindu and a Jew who live in Northern Ireland explain what Christmas means to them.

item.title: A Christmas Carol - with a Belfast twist
item.description: Charles Dickens' novella has been reimagined by playwright Marie Jones in the setting of Victorian Belfast.

item.title: In pictures: Helen's Bay Christmas Eve swim
item.description: Hundreds of people took part in the annual Christmas Eve dip.

item.title: My friend Henry the Robin - how a tame bird went viral
item.description: Henry the robin has become "world famous" after videos of his visits to Tom went viral.

item.title: Meet the 12-year-old racer who is making waves in her sport
item.description: Meet Andie Stewart, the 12-year-old from Northern Ireland, who is breaking new ground in go-kart racing.

item.title: The dementia choir that's changing lives
item.description: Age Concern Causeway formed the choir to help people on the north coast living with dementia.

item.title: 'Community cinemas bring people together'
item.description: The society's aim was to screen films that were less likely to be found in mainstream cinemas.

item.title: Irish Premiership ready for 'highlight of the year'
item.description: BBC Sport NI takes a look at all six of the Boxing Day matches in the Irish Premiership.

item.title: Can rugby star's stolen caps be found after 40 years?
item.description: Ken Goodall's haul of Irish international caps were taken from his home in Londonderry in 1987.

item.title: 'We've tried to hide the gaps in the walls with Christmas decorations'
item.description: In the Republic of Ireland, thousands of family homes are affected by defective concrete blocks.

item.title: 'Sobriety is my superpower at Christmas', says recovering addict
item.description: A 33-year-old comedian from Londonderry is preparing for his third Christmas substance-free.

item.title: What do you do if you don't celebrate Christmas?
item.description: A Muslim, a Hindu and a Jew who live in Northern Ireland explain what Christmas means to them.

item.title: Meet the working dogs that don't stop for Christmas
item.description: For some of Northern Ireland's dogs with jobs, a busy Christmas lies ahead.

item.title: The dementia choir that's changing lives
item.description: Age Concern Causeway formed the choir to help people on the north coast living with dementia.

item.title: NI farm families 'in a better place' after inheritance tax plan climbdown
item.description: Government proposals to tax inherited farmland have been watered down, with the planned threshold increasing from £1m to £2.5m.

item.title: Firefighters put out blaze at water treatment works
item.description: Firefighters were called to a report of a fire on the roof of an NI Water treatment facility in Portrush.

item.title: Man charged following serious assault
item.description: The 18-year-old man has been charged with grievous bodily harm with intent.

item.title: 'Drug-driving at Christmas shows people are selfish'
item.description: The PSNI says since the beginning of its winter drink-drive campaign, 50% of drivers tested for drugs have come back positive.

item.title: Work to restore Austins building to begin in early 2026
item.description: The landmark Georgian era building that dominates the city's Diamond has lay empty for almost a decade.

item.title: Bridge barriers should be raised after 'preventable' death, inquest finds
item.description: The death of a man who fell from the Foyle Bridge in Londonderry was preventable, a coroner has ruled.

item.title: Restoring railway 'could take 20 years'
item.description: The line between Londonderry and Portadown is seen as key to improving cross border travel across the island of Ireland.

item.title: Pupils of closed school given 'wonderful solution'
item.description: Nazareth House closed on 3 December after an inspection of the roof found that it was unsafe.

item.title: Men plead not guilty to manslaughter of three teens outside disco
item.description: Two men are charged over a crush in County Tyrone in 2019 in which three teenagers lost their lives.

item.title: Man denies murder of woman in County Londonderry town
item.description: Andrzej Pajaczkowski is accused of the murder of Sophie Watson in August 2024.

item.title: Families question use of do-not-resuscitate orders
item.description: Families of two women who died in hospital have questioned the use of "do-not-resuscitate orders".

item.title: Nazareth House pupils will move to different school in New Year
item.description: The aim is to have the Nazareth House school community return to learning on their own site by half-term break in February 2026.

item.title: Man jailed for blackmailing woman over intimate images
item.description: Jordan McKeever, 27, from Glenview Drive, Limavady, will serve two years in prison and two on supervised license.

item.title: Department apology for Lidl 5-year planning wait
item.description: The supermarket chain still has no decision on its plans to build a store at Crescent Link in Londonderry.

item.title: Judgement reserved in illegal Easter parade case
item.description: The four men deny playing roles in a dissident republican commemoration in Derry in 2023.

item.title: Lidl to create 100 new jobs in £31m investment in north west
item.description: The supermarket chain unveiled plans for three new stores which will create more than 100 retail jobs.

item.title: Boy, 16, dies in tractor crash
item.description: The teenager was the sole occupant of the tractor which crashed on Saturday in County Clare.

item.title: Irish citizen detained in US freed after husband appeals to Congress
item.description: Donna Hughes-Brown has reunited with her family after five months in an immigration detention unit in Kentucky.

item.title: Man jailed over €6m drugs seizure
item.description: Padraig Casey has been found guilty of five counts relating to the seizure of cannabis and cocaine in June 2020.

item.title: 'They look hideous' - Battle over the Irish flag on Dublin streets
item.description: Irish tricolour flags have been erected on street lights all over Dublin in recent months in what has been branded by some as an anti-immigration campaign.

item.title: Jim Gavin 'asked about rental dispute three times before selection'
item.description: The controversy surrounding the former tenant later led to Mr Gavin's withdrawal from the Irish presidential campaign.

item.title: Investigation launched over child's death
item.description: The remains of Daniel Aruebose, who is believed to have gone missing when he was about three, were found on County Dublin.

item.title: Houses searched as part of fire murder inquiry
item.description: Irish police are searching houses in counties Kildare and Offaly after two people died in an arson attack last week.

item.title: Police release CCTV footage of 'callous' attack on house
item.description: Police have described it as a "reckless, callous and murderous attack on a family home".

item.title: Taoiseach says drones 'not a threat' to Zelensky aircraft
item.description: Micheál Martin tells the Irish Parliament that the incident was very concerning.

item.title: Evidence of burial ground at Tuam mother and baby home
item.description: Agency said it found "graves of child or infant size" at an area on the western edge of the site.

item.title: Irish police investigating drone activity during Zelensky visit
item.description: The Irish police force says it is investigating the matter after reports of drones near Dublin around the time the Ukrainian president landed.

item.title: Boycotts and arguments - can the Eurovision Song Contest survive its biggest crisis?
item.description: The biggest crisis in the Eurovision Song Contest's history raises major questions about its future.

item.title: Murder probe after child and woman die in Offaly house fire
item.description: Mary Holt, aged 60, and Tadhg Farrell, aged four, died in a house fire in County Offaly.

item.title: Irish battalion safe after coming under fire in south Lebanon
item.description: A Defence Forces spokesperson said the 127 Infantry Battalion came under fire while conducting a patrol.

item.title: Ireland boycotts Eurovision after Israel allowed to compete
item.description: There had been calls for Israel's exclusion over the war in Gaza, as well as unfair voting accusations.

item.title: Senior Irish government figures briefed on drone presence during Zelensky visit
item.description: The Irish Defence Forces says it had no comment on "any alleged incidents" during the visit.

item.title: How the Irish border was created
item.description: The Boundary Commission plan to adjust the border and remove places from NI was ditched in a British-Irish deal

item.title: Some Irish officers to get tasers in new six-month pilot scheme
item.description: The six-month scheme, set to roll out in Dublin, Waterford and Kilkenny will see about 128 officers given the stunguns.
